bboxes.raw_text:
would like to thank all of my
wonderful friends who we're SO
kind during my husband Illness.
Thank you for the beautiful flo
raj gifts, lovely cards, vista
tons, telephone calls and tempt
ing delicacies.


Your thoughtfulness will al
ways be cherished by us.


Mrs. D. w. Williams

Anyone who's gonna get seri-
Gus about catching large
mouth black bass on a flyrod
ana a pepper bug will have to
remember a number of items.
He'll want to recall that dur
ing the warm months bass feed
in the shadows in early morn
ings and late evenings, and the
Shoal waters are where he'll
want to present his popping
bugs.


He'll remember that the first
few feet of water next to the
shore is where the hungry bass
will feed. and he'll confine his
casts to that area; perhaps by
donning a pair of hip waders
and strolling around the edge
of the lake as he casts, perhaps
by throttling his Mercury out
board down to purr and cast
ing as he travels along at drift
speed, flicking the edge of the
water with his pepper bug.


He'll balance his outfit


for pepper bugs, remem-


bering that it takes a


heavier line and longer rod


to present bugs properly


than it does to drop a dry


fly on the surface of a


quiet trout pool. He'll use


a long leader, say nine feet,


tapered to a whisper at the


business end, and tied di-


rectly to the pepper.


And he'll reverse the obvious
by recalling that in pepper bug
fishing the race belongs to the
slow. He'll cast his bug so that
it lands a foot or so from shore
with a gentle "whap" - then
let it lie quietly until all the
ripples have disappeared. Then
he tightens the line enough to
make the bug twitch, but gent
ly, giving the impression of a
large insect that has fallen on
the water and is unable to get
airborne. He keeps twitching
and Tightening the line, slowly,
all the way during the retrieve.


He'll remember that va


riety is the spice of life


to a bass as we'll as to an


angler, and he'll vary his


retrieveS as much as pos


sible, first one way and


then another, giving free


rein to his inventiVenesS


and fishing skill, trying to


make that bug look as much


like moth as possible.


And, if he remembers all
these things, he'll catch fish.
Simple. isn't it? ...


x 4 =


Want to improve your bowling
delivery? Don't release the ball
until your slide has come to a
stop. Otherwise, you're likely to
be off balance, causing you to pull
your arm off line in the follow
through.

Ahs A1 90
ySWNN'
> BY BOB BREWSTER
Outdoor Editor,

NEW YORK = Singer Leslie Ug-
gains, FL, who appears frequently
on the Sing Along with Mitch TV
show, announced her engagement
to Ronnie Eckstine. Fl yr. old son
of singer Billy Eckstine.

Leslie Uggums To
Wed Ronnie Ecksiine

surprise birthday party hosted for Henry Smith by Miss
Margaret Shannon Burgess Lane Saturday night
MIR. Mrs. Charles Robinson Charles CraW
ford Arthur Holt, Billie Roberts and Otha Grimes.


Edwards Doris Collins,
Geraldine Sullivan Evelyn Johnson Laure Wright Ollie Johnson,
and Lee Ramirez.


Larry Doy j. B. Baker Bob Higgins and Len Land
attended,

Mrs. Jessie Ruth Deadwyler Nicholson, Athens
collects $4,000 year dollar day person for the right
fish in her lake.


Family farmers may obtain credit Farmers
Home Administration develop lakes and ponds fishing
swimming build vacation cottages lodges provide
producing recreation enterprises Mrs. Deadvyer
husband established their
lied to make such loans. USDA Photo
